commonProblems.solution: Pros design xeriscapes and install smart irrigation systems that can reduce outdoor water usage by 30-50%.
Specialists use native plant palettes specifically chosen to survive and thrive in intense Texas summers and sudden freezes.

commonProblems.problem: Muddy, shaded areas where grass won't grow
commonProblems.solution: Designers replace struggling lawns with shade-tolerant groundcovers, gravel paths, or native woodland gardens.
Our network specializes in deer-resistant planting plans using unpalatable texture and scent strategies (like sage, rosemary, and yucca).

process.title: Vision & Site Analysis
process.description: Designers assess sun exposure, soil quality, and existing vegetation to understand what will thrive in your specific microclimate.

process.title: Design & Plant Selection
process.description: Design collaboration on a plan that balances color, texture, and maintenance needs, selecting from locally-grown native stock.

process.title: Site Preparation
process.description: Removal of old sod, soil amendment with high-quality compost, and grading to ensure healthy root establishment.

process.title: Installation & Irrigation
process.description: Precise planting and setting up drip lines or high-efficiency rotors to deliver water exactly where needed.

process.title: Walkthrough & Care Guide
process.description: Pros explain how to care for your new landscape and adjust your watering schedule for establishment vs. long-term.

faqs.q: How much water will I save with xeriscaping?
faqs.a: Many homeowners see a reduction of 50-75% in outdoor water use after converting a traditional lawn to a well-designed xeriscape with drip irrigation.

faqs.q: Does 'native landscaping' mean just cactus and rocks?
faqs.a: Not at all! Native landscaping includes lush flowering perennials, vibrant shrubs, ornamental grasses, and shade trees. It can be colorful and full of life.

faqs.q: How fast can I get matched with a landscaping specialist?
faqs.a: Most projects receive introductions to 2-3 vetted landscape teams within 24 hours. Larger design-build scopes may include a discovery call first to align budgets and timelines.
